title: Lesson 59
paragraph: This lesson focuses on death and legacy, including remembrance, memorials, and inheritance.

words.meaning: the state of being subject to death
words.example: The book reflects on human mortality.
A plaque was placed in remembrance of the victims.

words.meaning: a speech praising someone who has died
words.example: He delivered a heartfelt eulogy at the funeral.

words.meaning: a mass for the dead or a musical composition honoring the dead
words.example: The choir sang a solemn requiem.

words.meaning: a ceremony or celebration in honor of someone or something
words.example: The statue is a commemoration of historical heroes.

words.meaning: the assets or traits passed down from previous generations
words.example: He received a large inheritance from his grandfather.
The aftermath of the war was devastating.

words.meaning: the state of going beyond ordinary limits; surpassing
words.example: Art can provide a sense of transcendence.

words.meaning: something established to remember a person or event
words.example: The memorial park honors fallen soldiers.

words.meaning: an inscription on a tombstone in memory of the deceased
words.example: The epitaph read, 'Beloved father and husband.'
